candidates.title: fix: Clean up sentry-actix toml
candidates.body: Small oversight that I missed reviewing #282

candidates.title: feat: actix-web 3 support
candidates.body:
I refactored the middleware by basing it on 'official' v3 middleware (logger, cors, etc.) Some of the Sentry implementation was re-used from https://github.com/mozilla-services/autopush-rs/blob/9b93817776bb7c8f27383185a1b5ce08607a6b35/autoendpoint/src/middleware/sentry.rs (v2.0 middleware, adapted for v3.0 and `wrap`-style middleware).

Example is updated and tested locally.

Bumped minimum Rust version to 1.42.0 because that's what actix-web 3.0 targets.

Resolves #143

candidates.title: fix: Update surf and unbreak CI
candidates.body: fixes #271

candidates.title: ref: Rearchitect the log and slog Integrations
candidates.body: In hindsight, putting all the filters/mappers on the Hub/Client-bound Integration was a mistake, and all that should be inside a lightweight logger.

candidates.title: ref: Deprecate public fields on Integrations
candidates.body: Not really sure if I should deprecate these first, or just break them right away. I don’t think people use these integrations directly a lot.

candidates.title: ref: Deprecate failure and remove error-chain
ref: Remove deprecated feature flags and items
candidates.body: This also officially deprecates the `error_chain` integration.

candidates.title: fix: Improve transport synchronization and consume response
candidates.body: The synchronization fixes have been proposed in #172 originally

candidates.title: chore: Update to use `im 15.0.0`
candidates.body:
(that fix was simple and not at all obvious)

Closes #253

candidates.title: feat: Add basic session support
candidates.body:
This adds release health sessions to the SDK, with some things that require special attention:

* sessions live on the scope.
* sessions are forward-inherited, which means that creating a new Hub from another one, and pushing scopes will use the exact same session.
* however, sessions are not backward-inherited, which means that starting a new session will not propagate backwards to any parent scopes/hubs.

So far, intermediate session updates are sent along with normal events, however session end updates are sent on their own and not yet batched together. This means that request-mode sessions are not yet as efficient as we would like them to be.

candidates.title: feat: Convert Transport to deal with Envelopes
ref: Rename Future exports and document features
meta: Draft a changelog and update docs/features
candidates.body:
* Updates the main documentation.
* Renames the transport-related feature flags.
* Drafts a changelog highlighting the breaking changes.

candidates.title: fix: Upgrade and pin surf, to avoid breakage
meta: Streamline Cargo.toml and README files
candidates.body:
* All the `Cargo.toml` files should have the same structure.
* README files should have the same structure.
* Streamline versions and dev-dependencies.
* Remove the DSN from the examples.

candidates.title: feat: Add support for surf HTTP client
candidates.body: This PR provides support of [surf](https://github.com/http-rs/surf) HTTP client as an alternative to reqwest and curl.

candidates.title: feat: Add a `slog` Integration
candidates.body:
This Integration consists of both an `Integration` part, as well as a
`Drain` part.

The Integration can be configured with custom filters and mappers.

fixes #160 
closes #161 
closes #172

candidates.title: ref: Restructure and document the public core API
candidates.body:
The `sentry-core` exports have been a bit restructured, other things in
`sentry` have been marked as deprecated.

candidates.title: ref: Clean up the feature flags a bit
candidates.body: Cleans up the feature flags of `sentry-core`, but tries to keep the existing feature flags of `sentry`, for backwards compatibility. Not quite sure if we want to do that, or rather just remove the non-default features, and rename the others.

candidates.title: feat: Add support for std::future::Future
candidates.body:
Adds a new `SentryFuture` type, which activates a hub for the duration
of a `poll`.

candidates.title: ref: Move debug_meta into a separate package
candidates.body:
This creates a new `DebugImagesIntegration`, which can be configured
with an optional filter. By default, *all* events will get a list of
loaded libraries attached, depending on OS support.

candidates.title: feat: Add anyhow Integration
candidates.body:
Unfortunately, it does require a separate integration/method, since
`anyhow::Error` does not impl `std::error::Error`.

candidates.title: Bump findshlibs to 0.7.0
candidates.body:
findshlibs 0.5.0 has a serious defect in `SharedLibrary::id`, where it
uses file sizes and offsets when examining the PT_NOTE sections of an
ELF binary instead of the memory size/offset fields. This issue was
corrected by gimli-rs/findshlibs@046a431, but was released along with a
couple of semver breaking changes so it needs a bump in Cargo.toml to be
picked up.

This has a fairly major impact on projects where you have `with_debug_meta` enabled,
as it can lead to all sorts of issues, ranging from at best corrupted crash uploads reaching
Sentry, to SEGFAULTs when a thread panics, to wild UB as we try and read from totally
random memory addresses.

We have tested this in production by patching `findshlibs` with Cargo's patch function.

I'd suggest pushing out a 0.18.1 release for this if possible, given the impact of the above.

candidates.title: ref: Move Contexts out of core
candidates.body: This moves the `os`, `rust` and `device` contexts and associated features into a separate crate which is configurable.

candidates.title: feat: Add support for `std::error::Error`
candidates.body:
This adds support directly to `sentry-core` instead of an integration.

fixes #151

candidates.title: ref: Move backtrace support out of sentry-core
candidates.body: Moves the `sentry_core::backtrace_support` into its own crate, and creates two new integrations, one that is responsible for attaching thread backtraces to events, the other one to trim and classify backtraces.

candidates.title: ref: Move failure and panic integration out of core
candidates.body:
This also makes the PanicIntegration configurable with additional
extractors.

candidates.title: ref: Move error-chain integration out of core
ref: Move log integration into separate crate
candidates.body: This is on top of #202 although it is independent from that PR.

candidates.title: ref: Move transports out of sentry-core
candidates.body: This is on top of #199 and gets rid of some feature flags in sentry_core \o/

candidates.title: ref: Move ClientOptions defaults out of sentry-core
candidates.body:
This is in preparation for moving default transports and integrations
out of `sentry-core`.

There were some slight changes:
* `ClientOptions.transport` is now an `Arc`,
  avoiding the extra clone trait
* `init` is not be called with a `Client` anymore
* `ClientOptions` defaults are now moved out of sentry-core

candidates.title: ref: Move the init function to sentry crate
candidates.body:
This is in preparation of moving the default options to the sentry
crate as well, which is needed to move the default transport and
integrations out of `sentry-core`.

Along with this, it removes some deprecated functions.

candidates.title: ref: Rename to sentry-core and reexport
candidates.body:
This moves the *src* of `sentry` to `sentry-core`, keeping the
`examples` and `tests` in place.

The `sentry` crate now just re-exports everything, and hands over
feature flags transparently.

The doctests have a `use sentry_core as sentry` in them to not require
code changes.

candidates.title: meta: Import sentry-types into the monorepo
candidates.body:
This imports the whole sentry-types repo, including all its history.
This was done using:
```
git remote add types https://github.com/getsentry/rust-sentry-types.git
git fetch types master

… move things into the sentry-types directory, delete everything unrelated …

git commit --all
git checkout -b types-head
git checkout master
git merge types-head --allow-unrelated-histories
```

candidates.title: ref: Move sentry into a workspace member
fix: Move reqwest init off the main thread
candidates.body: fixes #184

Note that this is a minimal effort to bring `sentry-rust` up to speed. We will be looking into trimming it down and adding more integrations at a later point.

Fixes #156
Fixes #159
Fixes #171

candidates.title: feat: Upgrade to new findshlibs
feat: Make openssl optional
candidates.body: Trial to make #137 work

candidates.title: feat: add support for openssl-less builds
candidates.body:
This issue is related to #88 and would prevent issues like it when
openssl 1.2 comes out.

Currently, sentry-rust depends on reqwest with default feature flags,
which pulls in `native-tls` and `openssl`.

This causes multiple issues:

1. On systems without openssl header packages installed, openssl-sys
   won't build.
2. If distributions like arch linux update to newer versions of openssl,
   issues like #88 will arise
3. Systems that don't support openssl are not supported (although
   targeting embedded systems with non-unix OSes is probably not a goal
   in this project)

This commit adds support for building reqwest with rustls support, using
the new feature flag ~~`rustls`~~ `with_rustls`.

This fixes #136.

candidates.title: ref: Update dependencies and dev env
candidates.body: Aligns the makefile, updates dependencies and fixes clippy lints from Rust 1.34.0

candidates.title: feat: Support for curl and disabled transports
candidates.body:
This pull request provides two features: disabling all built in transports
and using curl as an optional transport instead of reqwest.

This should cut down on a lot of extra dependencies for users that do not
want to pull in all of tokio.

candidates.title: feat: Update to newer findshlibs that resolves issues on linux
candidates.body: This skips over non code segments. Support for this was added in 0.4.1.

candidates.title: ref: Upgrade to Rust Edition 2018
candidates.body: Since some of our dependencies require Edition 2018 now, I figure we could upgrade right away.

candidates.title: feat: 2018 edition fixes and various cleanups.
candidates.body: This also fixes #115

candidates.title: feat: Debug ID support for Linux

This follows up on #112 

It's basically the same code with a small fix.

chosen_pr.title: feat: actix-web 3 support
chosen_pr.body:
I refactored the middleware by basing it on 'official' v3 middleware (logger, cors, etc.) Some of the Sentry implementation was re-used from https://github.com/mozilla-services/autopush-rs/blob/9b93817776bb7c8f27383185a1b5ce08607a6b35/autoendpoint/src/middleware/sentry.rs (v2.0 middleware, adapted for v3.0 and `wrap`-style middleware).

Example is updated and tested locally.

Bumped minimum Rust version to 1.42.0 because that's what actix-web 3.0 targets.

Resolves #143
